results.title: About three hundred million years ago...
results.creator_credit: Jean Hunt, James Allen and ABC-TV (Australia)
results.brief_description: Shows geologists collecting data to make a geological map and the subsequent laboratory work required to identify the structure and composition of the samples collected. Once the information is compiled, the map can be drawn and ideas about the geological history of the area can be formed. Narrated by Sydney Conabere and photographed by Don Whitehurst. Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: Ghana: primary products
results.brief_description: Shows how a developing country’s economic livelihood depend on the production and export of a narrow range of raw materials. Practically all of Ghana’s export earnings come from a short list of primary products, headed by cocoa, and timber. Concludes with the important point that the slightest shift in world cocoa or timber prices can send shock waves through the whole economy.

results.title: Ghana: using what's around you
results.brief_description: This film shows how people living in a remote areas make do with a narrow range of foods and raw materials obtained from their immediate surroundings and how the rural technique of skilful improvisation with minimal tools and materials has been transferred to market towns.

results.title: Journey through nutrition land
results.brief_description: Animated figures in a dream sequence introduce food nutrients, their function and their source. Suitable for middle and upper primary and lower secondary levels.

results.title: Their world
results.brief_description: This film explores the significance of play as a preparation for life and is an insight into child beahviour and personality. By confonting a selection of children with a “mini world” each child is invited to build his or her world using a vast assortment of tiny props. Hungarian dialogue with English subtitles.

results.title: The Secret sharer
results.creator_credit: Joseph Conrad, Larry Yust and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description: A screen adaptation of a Joseph Conrad short story. This film concerns a young, inexperienced sea captain’s encounter with a fugitive from naval justice. Follows the captain endangering his ship through helping the fugitive, and shows how he regains control.

results.title: Teaching machines and programmed learning
results.creator_credit: James Learmonth, Digby Duncan and Gateway Educational Films
results.brief_description: This film explains the use of teaching machines in the classroom. It demonstrates simple and complex machines and defines programmed learning into two types - linear and branching.

results.title: Hockey. Film 3. Advanced skills
results.creator_credit: Sally Methven and University of Queensland
results.brief_description: Covers advanced skills: the flick, the penalty stroke, the art of goalkeeping and reverse stick hitting. All skills are described clearly in diagrams and in a game.

results.title: Hockey. Film 2. Basic skills
results.creator_credit: Sally Methven and University of Queensland
results.brief_description: Covers the skill of pushing and the tactics involved in the push in - demonstrating where players stand, both in offence and defence, dodging and tackling are the other two important skills covered very thoroughly.

results.title: Hockey. Film 1. Basic skills
results.creator_credit: Sally Methven and University of Queensland
results.brief_description: Covers some of the basic skills used in hockey: hitting, stopping, pushing and dribbling. It also provides instruction on the bully or start of a game and positions of players on the field. A discussion of both forward and defence players, including the goalkeeper.
